text:
Lech Ordon (24 November 1928 – 21 October 2017) was a Polish actor. In 1948, he graduated from The Aleksander Zelwerowicz National Academy of Dramatic Art in Warsaw, at the time located in Łódź. He was born in Poznań. He was known for his roles in "Letters to Santa", "Der Schimmelreiter", "Czterdziestolatek" and in "Mister Blot's Academy".
In December 2008, he was awarded the Medal for Merit to Culture – Gloria Artis. He died on 21 October 2017 in Warsaw from pneumonia complicated by a stroke at the age of 88.

annotations.surface_form: The Aleksander Zelwerowicz National Academy of Dramatic Art in Warsaw
Medal for Merit to Culture – Gloria Artis
